title: Abbatty
author: Abbatty
content: I've been a member of this forum for a while, but I spend the majority of my time in the bounty section because I was introduced to the forum to take part in bounty campaigns, which I won't say have been very profitable so far. When I informed this person that I wanted to learn about bitcoin and cryptocurrencies so that I could someday earn money for myself, he misinterpreted me, therefore he continued to educate me about bounties so that I could earn some free token. I am aware that some people make significant profits through bounties, but from the start, I was aware that I wanted more than merely taking part in bounties. I was interested in learning everything there was to know about bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general, but I had no one to teach me. I tried searching online, but some of the concepts were too complex for me to understand, so I needed some guidance.Without anyone's help, I began studying the forum and gradually, I began understanding some things, and I learned that bounties are no longer as profitable as they once were and that they are simply a waste of time and also I figured that I can learn more about bitcoin here. I've been a little busy lately, which has reduced the amount of time I spend here, but I believe I'm finally prepared to embark on the path to becoming a bitcoin expert. I desire a new beginning and am hoping that my prior participation in bounties was not improper. In order to accomplish this aim of mine, I will need all of your help and guidance. Please From where do I begin?

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: Since you have already been on the forum for little long and have been active on the bounty section I believe you have learned something on the background and could have made a quick view of the forum rules and regulations which could help your way in this forum. If you have not come across the forum rules you can go back and check through Ratimov Encyclopedia  you can be able to get what ever helpful link that you are looking for and it will guide your way around the forum and things you need to learn about bitcoin, wallet and security all can be found in their.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: As you have learned from joining bounty campaign that it isn't profitable or you can't earn decent amount of money from it and you decided to learn more about Bitcoin and crypto related stuff then that's good start in my opinion. Since you are looking for another way to earn money in the future then have you considered buying Bitcoin and hold it for as long as you want until it js sure to sell for profit. The one who introduced you to this forum is surely a bounty hunter where you ask that person another way to earn but still that person taught you about bounties when you already know that it's not fruitful for you.

comments.author: Ruttoshi
comments.body: I am happy that you have chosen to stop your bounty stuff and you have come to realize that it wouldn't take you anywhere. No time is late to start learning about bitcoin, as the forum is open for all to tap from her knowledge. You should read the forum rules if you have not,since this side other the forum wasn't familiar to you. Read more ams post less. Don't forget to use the search engine to search to get answers to your question. Who knows, you cmight be a good bitcoin investor tomorrow, that is why the knowledge is very important.Do your own research and stay away from plagiarism. You can improve yourself with this article. Beginners &Help Encyclopedia

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Abbatty on September 11, 2023, 10:13:55 PMPlease From where do I begin?As a newbie, I suggest stopping for a while a bounty hunting and spending more time reading rather than posting in the forum or joining Bounty stuff.  The more you gain knowledge which makes it becomes easy for you everything, from having technical skills about Bitcoin and a higher chance to rank up.Read every pinned thread on each section, that's very informative to us. Well, good luck with your journey, just always follow the rules and guidelines in the forum and you'll be alright.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: It's never too late to start afresh on a different route. The time and dedication will tell how fast you adjusted to the fresh part you've decided to join or follow. It all requires frequent research and reading of the bitcoin technology. How to do it? try to adjust some moments to read few stuffs about bitcoin. Take those terms you can understand, and practicalize your learning progress by opening threads on unique topics you feel or wish to be discussed here. The discussion aspect of the forum is what breaks down the learning process for everyone to understand. Because of diverse circulation of correct information, and the termination of wrong ones. Such that nobody gets misled.  Try to join discussions, and further read to understand an interesting discussion. It'll help you understand the way bitcoin works and how the forum does work, indeed. The bounty lane which you left, as you said, may have delayed you from learning, but the process never ends. Start now and make decisions on what you feel should be done in the bitcoin ecosystem and check if someone is already thinking about it too. This will help you stay on the edge of the discussion as it'll be an important role to share new ideas on the thread.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Abbatty on September 11, 2023, 10:13:55 PMPlease From where do I begin?All bounty hunters have one thing in common which is their main aim in this forum is to make money first. I suggest you change such a mentality because you might not be able to earn anything for a long time. Your main focus now should be how to learn and contribute to the forum. Invest time to go through different sections of boards in the forum and read the contents that interest you. If there are areas you don't understand you can do research on them and learn about them. The forum also has a search option that can assist you in seeking for information you desire. You can also use other search engines to seek vital information. You also need to read the rules of the forum to avoid violating any of them. I am sure you have heard that plagiarism is a capital offense that leads to a ban. And if you get banned you cannot come back to the forum with another account until you are unbanned. To avoid plagiarism always reference the source of your information if you copied or from somewhere. The use of chatbots to make posts is closely related to plagiarism so it could also lead to a ban. Ensure you also check the rules of each board before posting in the section Although you spent so much time chasing shadows in the bounty section it is never too late to be right. Bitcoin is still at its early stage which mean that you are early. There are still many people that are still blinded by the peanuts they get from the bounty section. Just be focused and you will be happy you took this decision.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: No, it is never too late to seek a new beginning. I remember when I was also starting here in this forum and in the Bitcoin world. I initially thought it was all about Bitcoin until I understood and learned that there is so much more to crypto as a whole. At first, all I knew was how to earn, especially through signature campaigns and other free opportunities, as well as completing tasks for pay. Like you, there have been many times when I've taken breaks from my Bitcoin and crypto journey for various reasons, but I'm still here, continuously educating myself with the help of our fellow members and staying updated with the evolving crypto universe and its underlying technology. We all need guidance, especially when seeking help. For me, this forum is the primary and major Bitcoin community for learning about cryptocurrency. You can join the discussion and ask questions. There are also free learning materials available on the internet, such as videos, online courses, tutorials, books, and more. Good luck with your new beginning and your journey to becoming a Bitcoin expert.

comments.author: Gallar
comments.body: Quote from: Abbatty on September 11, 2023, 10:13:55 PM~SnipPlease From where do I begin?If you want to start learning more about Bitcoin, you can start right now. Because after I saw your posting history, and when you were registered on this forum, it seems like you already have a good basis to start studying Bitcoin and investing in it. The date you registered on this forum is more than a year old, so I'm sure you basically understand a little about Bitcoin. Because even if you enter this forum, you only struggle with bounties. But usually, people like you, to some extent, already understand Bitcoin. So I think, to learn about bitcoin, you really just have to keep doing it. No need to repeat and start all over again. Because basically the crypto world doesn't have many or striking differences. Maybe the difference lies only in the cryptocurrency itself.As is the case with wallets, chances are you already understand a little about this, because even if you take part in the bounty, you definitely need something called a wallet. So therefore, your path to learning Bitcoin, I don't think will be too difficult.But if you want to learn about Bitcoin from the very basics, and also about its history, you can read about it on this sitehttps://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/bitcoin.asp#:~:text=Bitcoin%20(BTC)%20is%20a%20cryptocurrency,party%20involvement%20in%20financial%20transactions.

comments.author: mamesso
comments.body: Free tokens can't always make you money, there are certain obstacles that make you feel disappointed when the free tokens you get from Bounty don't have a price. Don't waste time on something that is not profitable, focus on things that can increase your knowledge while on the forum. Read all threads that can broaden your insight, then start contributing to the forum with quality posts to speed up the process of ranking up your account.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: Abbatty on September 11, 2023, 10:13:55 PMI've been a member of this forum for a while, but I spend the majority of my time in the bounty section because I was introduced to the forum to take part in bounty campaigns, which I won't say have been very profitable so far.Don't say it is because the person introduced you the forum and how you get profit from bounties. He introduced you this forum, you decided to join it and you have enough time to explore it if you are not lazy. Your friend gave you a door but in this forum, there are many other doors for you and you're free to open them. It's just you were lazy to discover the forum.QuoteI was interested in learning everything there was to know about bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general, but I had no one to teach me. I tried searching online, but some of the concepts were too complex for me to understand, so I needed some guidance.Do you write a fiction to lie?You even don't have to search, just need to get rid of your laziness and look at sticky threads. You will find many basic topics and learn many things from them.[Bitcointalk sticky threads] Newbies - read before starting.

comments.author: Sexylizzy2813
comments.body: No knowledge is a waste but OP let me ask, what was going through your mind when you first joined the bounty campaign?You know it wasn't what you wanted and you still have to spend some time there hoping for what to happen?Laying down there wasn't going to help you achieve what you have been fighting for which you know, you should have opted out earlier don't you think? Well that was your call any way.OP I believe you had that feeling of not getting things working out for you but you just choose to stick around but I'm happy you're out of where's keeping you from getting the knowledge you have always wanted.

comments.author: Fuso.hp
comments.body: Since you have been involved with crypto currency for a long time, I think you have nothing new to learn about crypto currency. You have been in the bounty section for a long time. Hopefully you have gained a fair understanding of Bitcoin or other coins by working in the bounty section for a long time. It is good to have experience on every topic in the forum. Since you have joined the Bounty Section, don't think that you haven't learned anything because there is a lot to learn from the Bounty Section as well. If you want to learn new about crypto currency then you should be active in other section of forum and try to learn something every day and also try to share your knowledge with forum. If you spend your time on the forum, you will definitely learn something from the forum that you can't learn from the bound section.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: I do not know what you mean with a new start, the beginning of learning, the beginning of money, or the beginning of why, the new beginning is always for a person who has lost something in the past and you have not lost only time, but you have enough time to collect more bitcoin before the end of next year, which may be the beginning of high prices .Learning is not associated with age or price. Even if you are 70 years old you will learn, but you have to expand from your perspective in Bitcoin and the forum, it is more than a place to win money or free aridrop rewards.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: No it's never too late to make a turn for good ok the forum, many top reputable people here has actually done that and now they have become better members of the forum.It's a great step to acknowledge that you have been doing the wrong thing, I believe that's the first step, I would have to be sincere with you that it won't be that easy but definitely it is achievable, you need to start from the beginning and be patient with the growth.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: Abbatty on September 11, 2023, 10:13:55 PMI've been a member of this forum for a while, but I spend the majority of my time in the bounty section because I was introduced to the forum to take part in bounty campaigns, which I won't say have been very profitable so far. Why has it been that so many of you will think of coming to bitcointalk to make money, this is bitcoin discussion forum for crying out loud, your friend that introduced you here am not is not on bounties but told you to come over there and make money, have he also consider the scam projects that are going there as well, also you could see that yourself that not until you make that determination to go the right way, no one ever told you bounties and a waste of time especially for newbies, you've been on the forum since last year and only have 66 activities and posts which means you have but been active as well, but it's never too late to start all over again, i will advise you this time to be active, read the forums rules and regulations, learn to give quality post, and you could have a new beginning.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: Abbatty on September 11, 2023, 10:13:55 PMI've been a little busy lately, which has reduced the amount of time I spend here, but I believe I'm finally prepared to embark on the path to becoming a bitcoin expert. I desire a new beginning and am hoping that my prior participation in bounties was not improper. In order to accomplish this aim of mine, I will need all of your help and guidance. Before you became an expert just start to have a newbie mindset. Which you are open to learn new things everyday and be consistent with that since if you quit since you find all of this hard then you cannot go anywhere with that.For now since you're starting up better start by browsing the threads here since for sure there's a lot to learn from that and always seek for feedback once you want to try something risky or on situation which you don't know what to do.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: The answer to your thread title is; No, it's never too late to start a new beginning here in the forum. Quote from: Abbatty on September 11, 2023, 10:13:55 PMPlease From where do I begin?You have already begun be admit the wrong step you took by joining bounties rather than gaining knowledge and participating in discussions here, so the next thing you should do is to go out there and research Bitcoin because if you're to stay in the forum you should be able to contribute to discussions significantly, in other words, you have to read, read,  and read. So this might be of help to you.  https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters https://www.bitcoin.com/get-started/ https://learnmeabitcoin.com/Beginners & Encyclopaedia  And before I forget, do well to familiarize the rules of the forum because when you were participating in bounties I'm sure you didn't take the time out to read the rules to know what was accepted and what was not.  Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ Feel free to ask questions if you should encounter any problems during your learning process, welcome to bttalk.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: mamesso on September 12, 2023, 02:09:35 AMFree tokens can't always make you money, there are certain obstacles that make you feel disappointed when the free tokens you get from Bounty don't have a price. Don't waste time on something that is not profitable, focus on things that can increase your knowledge while on the forum. Read all threads that can broaden your insight, then start contributing to the forum with quality posts to speed up the process of ranking up your account.Those tokens worth it during the early days of cryptocurrency. I learnt that it gave so many people good money and made some millionaires. But time flies and things changes. Most of those tokens no longer worth it when shared to the participants. Don't call it free token because the bounty hunters worked for it and the token is their reward.Op, you do not need the permission of anyone who introduced you here to study bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. If the person constantly monitors your account, you can create another account for the purpose of joining the forum conversation. Do not allow anyone to limit you. Your English is connected, so you can make good posts.

comments.author: Pingrapole
comments.body: You may not be happy where you are or doing as much as you need to, so I think you should either stop it or tell whoever is coming through if there is any other way In my opinion you should not work on bounty forum but make yourself to work on bitcoin discussion or work about bitcoin and try patience with him if you have your mind You can fulfill what you wantDo a lot of study to be on the forum and try and learn and hope you can, and it will reduce all your problems to some extent.
